'''GPE''' (an [[acronym]] for '''[[GNOME]] Palmtop Environment''' or '''[[GNU]] Palmtop Environment''' depending on whom you ask) is a [[graphical user interface]] environment for [[handheld computer]]s, such as [[palmtop]]s and [[personal digital assistant]]s (PDAs), running the [[Linux]] operating system. GPE is a complete environment of software components and applications which makes it possible to use a Linux handheld for tasks such as [[personal information management]] (PIM), audio playback, email, and web browsing.
Available under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]] and the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]], GPE is [[free software]].
==Supported devices==
GPE is bundled with embedded [[Linux distribution]]s targeting the following platforms:
* [[Sharp Zaurus]] * [[Hewlett-Packard]] [[iPAQ]] * Hewlett-Packard [[Jornada (PDA)|Jornada]] 72x * [[Siemens AG]] [[SIMpad]] SL4
In addition, GPE maintainers and the open source community are developing ports for additional devices:
* [[GamePark Holdings]] [[GP2x]] * [[Nokia 770 Internet Tablet|Nokia 770]] * [[Nokia N800]] * [[Palm TX]] * [[Palm, Inc.|Palm]] [[Treo 650]][http://www.grack.com/programming/misc/TreoLinux.html] * [[HTC Universal]] * [[HTC Typhoon]] * [[HTC Tornado]] * [[HTC Wizard]] * [[HTC Apache]] [http://www.handhelds.org/moin/moin.cgi/HTCApache]
On February 5, 2007, The GPE project announced [http://gpephone.linuxtogo.org/ GPE Phone Edition], a new variant of GPE developed for mobile phones.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxtogo.org/new-project-gpe-phone-edition |title=New Project: GPE Phone Edition |accessdate=2007-08-23 |last=Boor |first=Florian |date=2007-02-05}}</ref>
==Development== [[File:Gpe-2.7-sharp-zaurus-c1000.png|thumb|GPE on a Sharp Zaurus C1000]]
GPE is a [[X Window System]] based GUI, utilizing [[GTK+]] for interfaces and [[Matchbox (window manager)|Matchbox]] for window management. The project provides an infrastructure for easy and powerful application development by providing core software such as [[shared library|shared libraries]], database schemas, and building on available technology including [[SQLite]], [[D-BUS]], [[GStreamer]] and several more common standards defined by [[freedesktop.org]].
One of the major goals of the GPE project is to encourage people to work on [[free software]] for mobile devices and to experiment with new technologies.
Some of the applications already developed for GPE include:
* ''GPE-Contacts'' - A contacts manager * ''GPE-Calendar'' - The calendar application * ''GPE-Edit'' - A simple text editor * ''GPE-Filemanager'' - A file manager with [[MIME type]] and remote access support * ''GPE-Gallery'' - Small and easy to use image viewer * ''GPE-Games'' - A small collection of tiny games * ''GPE-Mini-Browser'' - A [[CSS]] and [[Javascript]] compatible compact web browser * ''GPE-Sketchbook'' - Create notes and sketches * ''GPE-Soundbite'' - A voice memo tool * ''GPE-ToDo'' - A task list manager * ''GPE-Timesheet'' - Track time spend on tasks * ''Starling'' - A GStreamer based audio player * ''[[VLC media player|VLC]]'' - A [[Media player (application software)|media player]]
GPE's PIM applications (GPE-Contacts, GPE-Calendar, GPE-ToDo) can be synchronized with their desktop and web counterparts (such as [[Novell Evolution]], [[Mozilla Sunbird]] and [[Google Calendar]]) through the use of ''GPE-Syncd'' and the [[OpenSync (software)|OpenSync]] framework.
GPE also contains a number of GUI utilities for configuring [[Wireless LAN|802.11 Wireless LAN]], [[Bluetooth]], [[IrDA]], [[Firewall (computing)|Firewall]], [[Advanced Linux Sound Architecture|ALSA]], [[Ipkg|Package Management]], among others.
A mobile [[push e-mail]] client based on the [[Tinymail]] framework is in development.

==Controversy==
There are ongoing controversies surrounding the GPE project regarding a change of hosting service, ownership of an [[IRC]] channel, and a trademark dispute.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linux.com/article.pl?sid=07/05/24/157218 | title= GPE project and Handhelds.org in acrimonious trademark dispute | accessdate=2007-08-18 |last=Willis |first=Nathan |date=2007-05-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://lwn.net/Articles/236287/ |title= Whose project is it anyway? | accessdate=2007-08-22 |last=Corbet |first=Jonathan |date=2007-07-07}}</ref>
===Web hosting===
Serious issues first began developing over a proposed change of hosting service. GPE had been hosted at [http://handhelds.org Handhelds.org] since April 2002. Some of GPE's developers suggested, and later followed through with, a move to [http://linuxtogo.org Linuxtogo.org] by October 2006.<ref>{{cite newsgroup |url=http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.handhelds.gpe/5523 |title=New home for GPE? |accessdate=2007-08-23 |author=Nils Faerber |date=2006-08-17 |newsgroup=gmane.comp.handhelds.gpe}}</ref> Handhelds.org responded by removing the user accounts of the departing developers, and any links or reference to the new [http://gpe.linuxtogo.org GPE Linuxtogo.org] location on the original [http://gpe.handhelds.org GPE Handhelds.org] site.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.handhelds.org/moin/moin.cgi/GPEProject?action=diff&date1=1167946855&date2=1164453993 |title= Diff for "GPEProject" - Handhelds.org MoinMoin Wiki |accessdate= 2007-08-23 |date=2007-01-04}}</ref>
===IRC channel===
Both parties claim ownership of the #gpe [[IRC]] channel located on [[freenode]]. Freenode has placed the channel in trust, or locked, until both sides can come to an agreement. Subsequently, Linuxtogo.org currently uses #gpe-project, and Handhelds.org uses #handhelds-gpe, both on Freenode.net.
===Trademark===
George France, a Handhelds.org administrator, has filed for trademark registration with the [[USPTO]] for GPE, in addition to [[OPIE user interface|OPIE]] and [[Ipkg]] as of March 6, 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://portal.uspto.gov/external/portal/tow?SRCH=Y&isSubmitted=true&details=&SELECT=US+Serial+No&TEXT=77123546# |title=US Serial No: 77123546, Application |accessdate=2007-08-23 |date=2007-03-26}}</ref> On June 25, 2007, the USPTO declined to accept a screenshot of the Handhelds.org GPE website as proof of Handhelds.org's ownership, and in addition requested a better specimen for a âGPE productâ.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://portal.uspto.gov/external/portal/tow?SRCH=Y&isSubmitted=true&details=&SELECT=US+Serial+No&TEXT=77123546# |title=US Serial No: 77123546, Offc Action Outgoing |accessdate=2007-08-23 |date=2007-07-25}}</ref> Handhelds.org, and [[Open Source Initiative|OSI]] board member [[Russ Nelson]], assert that the GPE project was given over to Handhelds.org for public development.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.handhelds.org/geeklog/article.php?story=20070525101908558 |title= The backstory to the trademarks |accessdate=2007-08-23 |last=Nelson |first=Russ |date=2007-05-25}}</ref>
The GPE developers working at Linuxtogo.org maintain that they represent the active GPE project, and Handhelds.org was only a hosting provider.<ref>{{cite newsgroup |url=http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.handhelds.ipaq.general/18811 |title=Re: crosscompiling question, ...Maybe this could be hosted on sourceforge.handhelds.org?... |accessdate=2007-08-23 |author=Nils Faerber |date=2001-12-21 |newsgroup= gmane.comp.handhelds.ipaq.general}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://fl0rian.wordpress.com/2007/05/23/threatened-update/ |title= Threatened - update |accessdate=2007-08-23 |last=Boor |first=Florian |date=2007-05-23}}</ref> Furthermore, they point out that the GPE project existed before it was hosted on Handhelds.org.<ref>{{cite newsgroup |url=http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.handhelds.ipaq.general/18846 |title= GPE - GNU PDA Environment |accessdate=2007-08-23 |author=Nils Faerber |date=2001-12-22 |newsgroup= gmane.comp.handhelds.ipaq.general}}</ref>
The USPTO issued a final rejection regarding the GPE trademark on February 27, 2008. George France amended the application (removing references to [[GNU]] and Linux). The GPE trademark was officially published for opposition June 3, 2008.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://tarr.uspto.gov/servlet/tarr?regser=serial&entry=77123546 |title=Latest Status Info |accessdate=2008-07-01 |date=2008-06-03}}</ref>
Despite George France's impending personal GPE trademark, the core GPE development team at Linuxtogo.org has abandoned much of the Handhelds.org GPE infrastructure. Linuxtogo.org developers have switched GPE to a new bootloader and replaced IPKG with OPKG, and made major changes to the GPE gui applications.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fl0rian.wordpress.com/2008/03/28/gpe-trademark-rejected/ |title= GPE trademark rejected |accessdate=2008-07-01 |last=Boor |first=Florian |date=2008-03-28}}</ref>
